title: Invalid `was not indexed at build time` on application reload
body:
### Describe the bug

Getting a REST client interface is working on first run, but when reloading the application (by pressing `s` in console), it fail with `REST client interface: interface toto.TotoResource was not indexed at build time`

### Expected behavior

It should work after reload.
If not, it should give an adapted error message, because this one does not match the situation.

### Actual behavior

Bogus message `REST client interface: interface toto.TotoResource was not indexed at build time`

### How to Reproduce?


[quarkus-rest-client-restart-issue.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/16347924/quarkus-rest-client-restart-issue.zip)


Use the attached project, run `./gradlew :app:quarkusDev`
Then press `s` <Enter>

you should have the folowing log :

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Darwin MacBook-Pro-de-Yann.local 23.5.0 Darwin Kernel Version 23.5.0: Wed May  1 20:14:38 PDT 2024; root:xnu-10063.121.3~5/RELEASE_ARM64_T6020 arm64

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "21.0.3" 2024-04-16 LTS OpenJDK Runtime Environment Temurin-21.0.3+9 (build 21.0.3+9-LTS) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM Temurin-21.0.3+9 (build 21.0.3+9-LTS, mixed mode)

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.12.0

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

 ------------------------------------------------------------ Gradle 8.8 ------------------------------------------------------------  Build time:   2024-05-31 21:46:56 UTC Revision:     4bd1b3d3fc3f31db5a26eecb416a165b8cc36082  Kotlin:       1.9.22 Groovy:       3.0.21 Ant:          Apache Ant(TM) version 1.10.13 compiled on January 4 2023 JVM:          21.0.3 (Eclipse Adoptium 21.0.3+9-LTS) OS:           Mac OS X 14.5 aarch64

### Additional information

This seems to be tied to calling thead and the easiest way to have a reproducer is calling from Swing UI thread. 
Internally, the `clazz` parameter of `ClientProxies` doesn't match the one in the map, but the ClientProxies is rebuild at reload, so I don't understand why ; it looks like a classloader issue but not sure.
